abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Power Rehabilitation
            Project is rated as satisfactory, sustainability as likely,
            institutional development impact as substantial, bank
            performance as satisfactory, borrower performance as
            unsatisfactory. The most important lesson learned from the
            project is that profitable, efficient commercial operation
            of energy enterprises in Georgia is difficult to achieve
            under public management. The recovery of the sector requires
            involvement of private strategic investors with sufficient
            clout to resist the political pressure and vested interest,
            and whose commercial interests are derived from a sustained
            and efficient operation of the companies rather than
            short-term political and commercial deals. Investment
            projects have to be accompanied by institutional and policy
            reforms needed to sustain project benefits. Actions on both
            fronts are needed as they are mutually re-enforcing.
            Coordination with other donors provided significant leverage
            and synergies, both within the project and through the
            associated Bank's operations. Ownership of the project,
            as well as of the accompanying reforms, is critical. At the
            project level, intensive technical assistance to the
            implementing agency in procurement, financial management,
            contract administration, and project management, and close
            supervision of the project have been very important.

5081221.trustfund: TF036514-GEORGIA - POWER REHABILITATION PROJECT,TF033206-GEORGIA - POWER REHABILITATION PROJECT,TF032450-GEORGIA - POWER,TF035958-GEORGIA - POWER PRIVATIZATION,TF036041-GEORGIA - POWER REHABILITATION

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objectives of the Power
            Rehabilitation Project for Georgia are to: a) increase the
            operational capacity and electricity generation of the power
            system; b) stabilize electricity supply; b) establish
            Tbilsresi as a commercially independent and financially
            self-sufficient generation company; and c) improve the local
            capability and assist in project management, corporate
            management and commercialization and privatization of power
            enterprises. The project consists of the following
            components: a) rehabilitation of a 300 MW unit at the
            Gardabani thermal power plant; b) increase in working
            capital at Tbilsresi; and c) technical assistance to
            Tbilsresi for project management, corporate management and
            development of a privatization strategy for the company.

694810.trustfund: TF036514-GEORGIA - POWER REHABILITATION PROJECT,TF036041-GEORGIA - POWER REHABILITATION,TF035958-GEORGIA - POWER PRIVATIZATION,TF033206-GEORGIA - POWER REHABILITATION PROJECT,TF032450-GEORGIA - POWER

repnme.cdata!:
Georgia - Power Rehabilitation Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Power Rehabilitation Project seeks
            to improve the operational capacity and electricity
            generation of the power system. One of the project
            components is the rehabilitation of a 300 MW (megawatt) unit
            at the Gardabani Thermal Power Plant. This environmental
            assessment took a preliminary examination of the influence
            of operating Unit 10 on the environment. Calculations and
            estimations to determine the pollution level of sulfuric
            anhydride, nitrogen dioxide, and vanadium tetroxide
            exhausted in atmosphere have been made, reference to the
            percentage of the sulfur in the liquid fuel with the
            variation from 1 to 4. It was clarified that in the case of
            the unit operating using 4 percent mazout, total nitrogen
            and sulfur concentration would be 0.3 possible limit rate.
            Using 1, 2 and 3 percent mazout at Unit 10 will cause
            serious pollution of the atmosphere. The study finds it
            possible to implement the rehabilitation project of Unit 10.
